title: Enhanced Knee Kinematics: Leveraging Deep Learning and Morphing Algorithms for 3D Implant Modeling
abstract: arXiv:2408.01557v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Accurate reconstruction of implanted knee models is crucial in orthopedic surgery and biomedical engineering, enhancing preoperative planning, optimizing implant design, and improving surgical outcomes. Traditional methods rely on labor-intensive and error-prone manual segmentation. This study proposes a novel approach using machine learning (ML) algorithms and morphing techniques for precise 3D reconstruction of implanted knee models.   The methodology begins with acquiring preoperative imaging data, such as fluoroscopy or X-ray images of the patient's knee joint. A convolutional neural network (CNN) is then trained to automatically segment the femur contour of the implanted components, significantly reducing manual effort and ensuring high accuracy. tldr: 该文章提出了一种使用机器学习和形态学技术精确构建植入膝关节模型的创新方法，该方法通过自动分割和形态生成算法，大幅度提高了膝关节植入物模型重建的精确性和效率，对优化手术规划和提高术后康复效果具有重要贡献。
